com.fluidops.fedx.util

Class QueryStringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.fedx.util.QueryStringUtil

  • public class QueryStringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Various static functions for query handling and parsing.
    Author:
    Andreas Schwarte

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.openrdf.model.URI BNODE_URI
      A dummy URI which is used as a replacement for BNodes in appendBNode(StringBuilder, BNode) since BNodes cannot be expressed in SPARQL queries
      static org.apache.log4j.Logger log

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI BNODE_URI

      • selectQueryString

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryString(FedXStatementPattern stmt,
                                 org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings,
                                 FilterValueExpr filterExpr,
                                 java.lang.Boolean evaluated)
                                          throws IllegalQueryException
        Construct a SELECT query for the provided statement.
        Parameters:
        stmt -
        bindings -
        filterExpr -
        evaluated - parameter can be used outside this method to check whether FILTER has been evaluated, false in beginning
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalQueryException - if the query does not have any free variables

      • selectQueryString

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryString(ExclusiveGroup group,
                                 org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings,
                                 FilterValueExpr filterExpr,
                                 java.lang.Boolean evaluated)
                                          throws IllegalQueryException
        Construct a SELECT query for the provided ExclusiveGroup. Note that bindings and filterExpr are applied whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        group - the expression for the query
        bindings - the bindings to be applied
        filterExpr - a filter expression or null
        evaluated - parameter can be used outside this method to check whether FILTER has been evaluated, false in beginning
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalQueryException

      • askQueryString

        Transform the exclusive group into a ASK query string
        Parameters:

        bindings -
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • selectQueryStringBoundUnion

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryStringBoundUnion(org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern stmt,
                                           java.util.List<org.openrdf.query.BindingSet> unionBindings,
                                           FilterValueExpr filterExpr,
                                           java.lang.Boolean evaluated)
        Construct a SELECT query string for a bound union. Pattern: SELECT ?v_1 ?v_2 ?v_N WHERE { { ?v_1 p o } UNION { ?v_2 p o } UNION ... } Note that the filterExpr is not evaluated at the moment.
        Parameters:
        stmt -
        unionBindings -
        filterExpr -
        evaluated - parameter can be used outside this method to check whether FILTER has been evaluated, false in beginning
        Returns:

      • selectQueryStringBoundJoinVALUES

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryStringBoundJoinVALUES(org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern stmt,
                                                java.util.List<org.openrdf.query.BindingSet> unionBindings,
                                                FilterValueExpr filterExpr,
                                                java.lang.Boolean evaluated)
        Creates a bound join subquery using the SPARQL 1.1 VALUES operator. Example subquery: SELECT ?v ?__index WHERE { ?s name ?v. } VALUES (?s ?__index) { (:s1 1) (:s2 2) ... (:sN N) }
        Parameters:
        stmt -
        unionBindings -
        filterExpr -
        evaluated - parameter can be used outside this method to check whether FILTER has been evaluated, false in beginning
        Returns:
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        SparqlFederationEvalStrategyWithValues, BoundJoinVALUESConversionIteration

      • selectQueryStringBoundCheck

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryStringBoundCheck(org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern stmt,
                                           java.util.List<org.openrdf.query.BindingSet> unionBindings)
        Construct a SELECT query for a grouped bound check. Pattern: SELECT ?o_1 .. ?o_N WHERE { { s1 p1 ?o_1 FILTER ?o_1=o1 } UNION ... UNION { sN pN ?o_N FILTER ?o_N=oN }}
        Parameters:
        stmt -
        unionBindings -
        Returns:

      • selectQueryStringIndependentJoinGroup

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryStringIndependentJoinGroup(IndependentJoinGroup joinGroup,
                                                     org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings)
        SELECT ?v_0 ?v_1 WHERE { { ?v_0 p1 o1 . } UNION { ?v_1 p2 o1 . } }
        Parameters:
        joinGroup -
        bindings -
        Returns:

      • selectQueryStringIndependentJoinGroup

        public static java.lang.String selectQueryStringIndependentJoinGroup(IndependentJoinGroup joinGroup,
                                                     java.util.List<org.openrdf.query.BindingSet> bindings)
        Construct a select query representing a bound independent join group. ?v_%stmt%_%bindingId$ SELECT ?v_0_0 ?v_0_1 ?v_1_0 ... WHERE { { ?v_0#0 p o UNION ?v_0_1 p o UNION ... } UNION { ?v_1_0 p o UNION ?v_1_1 p o UNION ... } UNION ... }
        Parameters:
        joinGroup -
        bindings -
        Returns:

                                       org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings)
        Construct a SELECT query for the provided statement with LIMIT 1. Such query can be used for source selection instead of ASK queries.

        bindings -
        Returns:

      • loadQueries

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadQueries(java.lang.String queryFile)
                                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                           java.io.IOException
        load the queries from a queries file located at the specified path. Expected format: - Queries are SPARQL queries in String format - queries are allowed to span several lines - a query is interpreted to be finished if an empty line occurs Ex: QUERY1 ... Q1 cntd QUERY2
        Parameters:
        queryType -
        Returns:
        a list of queries for the query type
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
